ppe_requirements.respiratory: NIOSH-approved organic vapor respirator with full facepiece for >10 ppm, SCBA or supplied-air for >50 ppm or unknown concentrations
ppe_requirements.skin: Nitrile gloves (>0.5mm), butyl rubber gloves, chemical-resistant clothing, impervious suit for spill response
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles and face shield for splash potential
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level B for spill response, Level C for operations <50 ppm
ppe_requirements.special_notes: Benzene is absorbed through skin - full body protection required. Change contaminated clothing immediately, do not reuse without decontamination.

physical_properties.appearance: Clear, colorless to pale yellow liquid
physical_properties.odor: Sweet, aromatic odor; Odor threshold: 1.5-4.7 ppm (variable, not reliable)

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Highly flammable liquid. Vapors heavier than air, may travel to ignition source. Forms explosive mixtures with air.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Dry chemical, CO2, alcohol-resistant foam. Water spray to cool containers and disperse vapors. Do not use direct water stream.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Evacuate area, eliminate ignition sources, ventilate confined spaces, contain with absorbent (sand, vermiculite), prevent entry to waterways, collect in sealed containers
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove to fresh air immediately. Remove contaminated clothing. Wash skin with soap and water for 15+ minutes. Flush eyes for 15+ minutes. Seek immediate medical attention - benzene poisoning can be delayed.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Toxic to aquatic life. Floats on water. Volatile - evaporates rapidly. Report spills >10 lbs to CERCLA.
emergency_response.special_hazards: Carcinogen - causes leukemia. May cause bone marrow depression with chronic exposure. Decomposes producing toxic carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide.

storage_requirements.ventilation: Local exhaust ventilation required, explosion-proof equipment, minimum 100 ft/min face velocity
storage_requirements.container_material: Steel, stainless steel, or aluminum containers. Avoid plastics that dissolve in benzene.
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from oxidizers, acids, halogens. Store in approved flammable liquid storage cabinet. Keep away from heat, sparks, open flames.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Flammable liquid storage per 29 CFR 1910.106: Maximum 10 gallons outside approved cabinet, 60 gallons inside safety cabinet
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Store in tightly sealed containers in cool, dry, well-ventilated area. Ground and bond containers during transfer. Use explosion-proof electrical equipment.

reactivity.stability: Stable under normal conditions. May polymerize with aluminum chloride catalyst.
reactivity.polymerization: Will not occur under normal conditions.
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: Reacts violently with strong oxidizers causing fire and explosion hazard. Attacks some forms of plastics, rubber, and coatings.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Toxic to aquatic organisms. LC50 (fish, 96h): 5.3-5.9 mg/L (rainbow trout). Toxic to algae and invertebrates.
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Readily biodegradable under aerobic conditions. >60% degradation in 28 days.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: Low potential. Log Kow: 2.13 (does not bioaccumulate significantly)
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: High mobility. Low soil adsorption. May leach to groundwater.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Photooxidation half-life: 4-17 days. Reacts with hydroxyl radicals. Does not undergo direct photolysis.

reportable_releases.water: 10 lbs (4.54 kg) to navigable waters (CWA Section 311)

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: NOT reliable indicator. Odor threshold (1.5-4.7 ppm) is above safe exposure levels and varies greatly. Do not rely on odor - use monitoring equipment.
